title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe one environmental problem associated with the release of methane into the atmosphere, such as any of the following:

  • It traps heat effectively leading to climate change/global warming

  • The greenhouse effect is enhanced, increasing global temperatures/warming

  • It is a greenhouse gas, which leads to climate change/global warming

  • It is a greenhouse gas, which leads to melting ice/rising sea levels

The response describes one environmental problem associated with the release of methane into the atmosphere, such as one of the following:

  • It traps heat effectively leading to climate change/global warming

  • The greenhouse effect is enhanced, increasing global temperatures/warming

  • It is a greenhouse gas, which leads to climate change/global warming

  • It is a greenhouse gas, which leads to melting ice/rising sea levels

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe one factor that could affect the decomposition of the solid waste in a landfill, such as any of the following:

  • The amount of/percentage of organic material in the solid waste

  • The amount of/percentage of non-degradable material in the solid waste

  • Conditions of the landfill (such as concentration of oxygen, population of microbes/decomposers, temperature, moisture)

  • Environmental conditions of the area (such as temperature, amount of rainfall, climate, weather, etc.)

The response describes one factor that could affect the decomposition of the solid waste in a landfill, such as one of the following:

  • The amount of/percentage of organic material in the solid waste

  • The amount of/percentage of non-degradable material in the solid waste

  • Conditions of the landfill (such as concentration of oxygen, population of microbes/decomposers, temperature, moisture)

  • Environmental conditions of the area (such as temperature, amount of rainfall, climate, weather, etc.)

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not propose a solution to decrease the amount of methane released from landfills into the atmosphere, such as any of the following:

  • Incinerate waste

  • Compost waste

  • Recycle/reuse non-synthetic organic waste (paper, textiles)

  • Install/Use methane collection systems

  • Burn off/Combust the methane coming from the landfill

The response proposes a solution to decrease the amount of methane released from landfills into the atmosphere, such as one of the following:

  • Incinerate waste

  • Compost waste

  • Recycle/reuse non-synthetic organic waste (paper, textiles)

  • Install/Use methane collection systems

  • Burn off/Combust the methane coming from the landfill

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not justify the solution in part (c) by describing an additional advantage, other than decreasing the amount of methane released from landfills, such as any of the following:
